Great Camera Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 29 October 2021 Style Name: DC-G9EB-K BodyPattern Name: SingleVerified Purchase Bought this as the other models on the market now are more aimed at V-Blogging and I wanted something that would specialise in stills. It's got so many features, including video, that it would take me all year to try them and review them but it's a lovely camera and dies take the most amazing stills. It's well thought out to the point of being a little too well thought out. They could get rid of some of the buttons and just have a toggle switch which would tidy the job up. Seller delivered almost a week early so very pleased with that. The only down side to the camera is the price as with all cameras and things to do with cameras they are expensive. Lynn 5.0 out of 5 stars Great camera for the price Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 21 June 2021 Style Name: DC-G9EB-K BodyPattern Name: SingleVerified Purchase The G9 is a big improvement over its predecessor the G8. I use it for wildlife photography to a large extent and the lack of delay, great focusing and excellent stabilisation features provide some good shots when coupled with the Lumix 100 - 400mm lens. I highly recommend. Helpful Report abuse Showing 0 comments There was a problem loading the comments at the moment. Please try again later. Alex 5.0 out of 5 stars Great camera, especially with a Warehouse deal Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 20 May 2021 Style Name: DC-G9EB-K BodyPattern Name: Single We bought this from Amazon Warehouse for about 60% of the current full price, and the quality is fantastic. Coming from Olympus OM-D EM5 (Mark 1), the image and video quality of the G9 is a step up. It's quite a large body, but the grip makes it easier to handle. Autofocus is much faster, and improved a lot more when we updated the firmware. It's interesting to compare this to my phone camera. It still doesn't do as well in low light as my Pixel, due to the processing that phones use. But if you're shooting with good lighting, the results are much better. Kindle Customer 5.0 out of 5 stars I'm not an expert but I appreciate class Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 13 February 2021 Style Name: DC-G9LEB-K + 12-60mm LensPattern Name: SingleVerified Purchase Great camera. I have used Sony and fujifilms before but this tops them all in both picture quality and build. I think Panasonic Lumix is very understated and surprised they are not used by more professional photographers. I have even used some Leicas in the past but this was better. 2 people found this helpful Helpful Report abuse Showing 0 comments There was a problem loading the comments at the moment. Please try again later. Alexander D'Aulerio 5.0 out of 5 stars Great intuitive camera Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 24 January 2021 Style Name: DC-G9LEB-K + 12-60mm LensPattern Name: SingleVerified Purchase Although this camera is quite large for M43, in fact larger than some FF camera bodies, it never feels cumbersome, and it's ergonomics are second to none! It's a real shame that other camera manufacturers don't put the same effort into ergonomics that Panasonic do. The tactile controls and the simple UI make driving this camera an absolute pleasure. The bundled Leica 12-60 is also a great optic and has pretty much replaced my Lumix 14-140 as my all rounder lens, working great for landscape, street, and portrait photography. I regularly use the camera body with larger tele lenses of the M43 catalogue and the balance that it offers with them is fantastic. I would say if you err on the side of smaller lenses there are probably better options, but for my wildlife and travel photography, this really is a Goldilocks camera/system, a powerhouse of a body, combined with a great catalogue of comparatively small, light and affordable lenses. In summary this is a great camera, sure it won't be the answer for everyone, but I think every system is about compromise. For me this ticks the boxes for usability, affordability and image quality. 2 people found this helpful Helpful Report abuse Showing 0 comments There was a problem loading the comments at the moment. Madden 5.0 out of 5 stars Worth the money Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 9 January 2021 Style Name: DC-G9EB-K BodyPattern Name: SingleVerified Purchase Not sure why I have to rate it by warmth and thickness, but this is a very fast, highly adaptable camera. Loads of functions, superb image quality. Good autofocus. I bought this after years of having a G3 which was very slow with an erratic autofocus, but I had lots of M4/3 lenses I didn't want to get rid of. 5.0 out of 5 stars Great Camera Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 29 October 2021 Style Name: DC-G9EB-K BodyPattern Name: SingleVerified Purchase Bought this as the other models on the market now are more aimed at V-Blogging and I wanted something that would specialise in stills. It's got so many features, including video, that it would take me all year to try them and review them but it's a lovely camera and dies take the most amazing stills. It's well thought out to the point of being a little too well thought out. They could get rid of some of the buttons and just have a toggle switch which would tidy the job up. Seller delivered almost a week early so very pleased with that. The only down side to the camera is the price as with all cameras and things to do with cameras they are expensive. Alex 5.0 out of 5 stars Great camera, especially with a Warehouse deal Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 20 May 2021 Style Name: DC-G9EB-K BodyPattern Name: Single We bought this from Amazon Warehouse for about 60% of the current full price, and the quality is fantastic. Coming from Olympus OM-D EM5 (Mark 1), the image and video quality of the G9 is a step up. It's quite a large body, but the grip makes it easier to handle. Autofocus is much faster, and improved a lot more when we updated the firmware. It's interesting to compare this to my phone camera. It still doesn't do as well in low light as my Pixel, due to the processing that phones use. But if you're shooting with good lighting, the results are much better. Alexander D'Aulerio 5.0 out of 5 stars Great intuitive camera Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 24 January 2021 Style Name: DC-G9LEB-K + 12-60mm LensPattern Name: SingleVerified Purchase Although this camera is quite large for M43, in fact larger than some FF camera bodies, it never feels cumbersome, and it's ergonomics are second to none! It's a real shame that other camera manufacturers don't put the same effort into ergonomics that Panasonic do. The tactile controls and the simple UI make driving this camera an absolute pleasure. The bundled Leica 12-60 is also a great optic and has pretty much replaced my Lumix 14-140 as my all rounder lens, working great for landscape, street, and portrait photography. I regularly use the camera body with larger tele lenses of the M43 catalogue and the balance that it offers with them is fantastic. I would say if you err on the side of smaller lenses there are probably better options, but for my wildlife and travel photography, this really is a Goldilocks camera/system, a powerhouse of a body, combined with a great catalogue of comparatively small, light and affordable lenses. In summary this is a great camera, sure it won't be the answer for everyone, but I think every system is about compromise. For me this ticks the boxes for usability, affordability and image quality. 2 people found this helpful Helpful Report abuse Showing 0 comments There was a problem loading the comments at the moment. body: Bought this as the other models on the market now are more aimed at V-Blogging and I wanted somethin

title:
Nice camera to start doing more videos without investing too much Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 18 October 2021 Style Name: DC-G9MEB-K + 12-60mm LensPattern Name: SingleVerified Purchase Got this after checking different options. Love the easy buttons to use and the menu is very friendly. Im a Canon user but wanted a more accesible (prize wise) camera to start doing more videos for my clients. Very happy so far :D Helpful Report abuse Showing 0 comments There was a problem loading the comments at the moment. Please try again later. a williams 5.0 out of 5 stars Best camera I have used Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 15 September 2021 Style Name: DC-G9EB-K BodyPattern Name: SingleVerified Purchase Forget its ability to let you set several instant personal program modes. Forget the easily to use lumix lenses of high quality. Just look at the images and for the PRICE find better. Face and eye recognition are almost perfect. Nikon, Canon and Sony are good certainly but at what price. One person found this helpful Helpful Report abuse Showing 0 comments There was a problem loading the comments at the moment. Please try again later. paul richards 5.0 out of 5 stars Would buy again Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 11 July 2021 Style Name: DC-G9MEB-K + 12-60mm LensPattern Name: SingleVerified Purchase Excellent camera would highly recommend Helpful Report abuse Showing 0 comments There was a problem loading the comments at the moment. Please try again later. Lynn 5.0 out of 5 stars Great camera for the price Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 21 June 2021 Style Name: DC-G9EB-K BodyPattern Name: SingleVerified Purchase The G9 is a big improvement over its predecessor the G8. I use it for wildlife photography to a large extent and the lack of delay, great focusing and excellent stabilisation features provide some good shots when coupled with the Lumix 100 - 400mm lens. I highly recommend. Helpful Report abuse Showing 0 comments There was a problem loading the comments at the moment. Please try again later. Alex 5.0 out of 5 stars Great camera, especially with a Warehouse deal Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 20 May 2021 Style Name: DC-G9EB-K BodyPattern Name: Single We bought this from Amazon Warehouse for about 60% of the current full price, and the quality is fantastic. Coming from Olympus OM-D EM5 (Mark 1), the image and video quality of the G9 is a step up. It's quite a large body, but the grip makes it easier to handle. Autofocus is much faster, and improved a lot more when we updated the firmware. It's interesting to compare this to my phone camera. It still doesn't do as well in low light as my Pixel, due to the processing that phones use. But if you're shooting with good lighting, the results are much better. One person found this helpful Helpful Report abuse Showing 0 comments There was a problem loading the comments at the moment. Please try again later. Steve S 5.0 out of 5 stars Fantastic camera. Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 12 March 2021 Style Name: DC-G9LEB-K + 12-60mm LensPattern Name: SingleVerified Purchase A really great camera, I'm new to photography and able to use its function's well, great pictures, and a lot of lens available. Helpful Report abuse Showing 0 comments There was a problem loading the comments at the moment. Please try again later. Kindle Customer 5.0 out of 5 stars I'm not an expert but I appreciate class Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 13 February 2021 Style Name: DC-G9LEB-K + 12-60mm LensPattern Name: SingleVerified Purchase Great camera. I have used Sony and fujifilms before but this tops them all in both picture quality and build. I think Panasonic Lumix is very understated and surprised they are not used by more professional photographers. I have even used some Leicas in the past but this was better. 2 people found this helpful Helpful Report abuse Showing 0 comments There was a problem loading the comments at the moment. Please try again later. Alexander D'Aulerio 5.0 out of 5 stars Great intuitive camera Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 24 January 2021 Style Name: DC-G9LEB-K + 12-60mm LensPattern Name: SingleVerified Purchase Although this camera is quite large for M43, in fact larger than some FF camera bodies, it never feels cumbersome, and it's ergonomics are second to none! It's a real shame that other camera manufacturers don't put the same effort into ergonomics that Panasonic do. The tactile controls and the simple UI make driving this camera an absolute pleasure. The bundled Leica 12-60 is also a great optic and has pretty much replaced my Lumix 14-140 as my all rounder lens, working great for landscape, street, and portrait photography. I regularly use the camera body with larger tele lenses of the M43 catalogue and the balance that it offers with them is fantastic. I would say if you err on the side of smaller lenses there are probably better options, but for my wildlife and travel photography, this really is a Goldilocks camera/system, a powerhouse of a body, combined with a great catalogue of comparatively small, light and affordable lenses. In summary this is a great camera, sure it won't be the answer for everyone, but I think every system is about compromise. For me this ticks the boxes for usability, affordability and image quality. 2 people found this helpful Helpful Report abuse Showing 0 comments There was a problem loading the comments at the moment. Please try again later. G. B. P. Madden 5.0 out of 5 stars Worth the money Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 9 January 2021 Style Name: DC-G9EB-K BodyPattern Name: SingleVerified Purchase Not sure why I have to rate it by warmth and thickness, but this is a very fast, highly adaptable camera. Loads of functions, superb image quality. Good autofocus. I bought this after years of having a G3 which was very slow with an erratic autofocus, but I had lots of M4/3 lenses I didn't want to get rid of. This has given me hopefully years more M4/3 use 2 people found this helpful Helpful Report abuse Showing 0 comments There was a problem loading the comments at the moment. Lynn 5.0 out of 5 stars Great camera for the price Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 21 June 2021 Style Name: DC-G9EB-K BodyPattern Name: SingleVerified Purchase The G9 is a big improvement over its predecessor the G8. I use it for wildlife photography to a large extent and the lack of delay, great focusing and excellent stabilisation features provide some good shots when coupled with the Lumix 100 - 400mm lens. I highly recommend. Helpful Report abuse Showing 0 comments There was a problem loading the comments at the moment. Please try again later. Alex 5.0 out of 5 stars Great camera, especially with a Warehouse deal Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 20 May 2021 Style Name: DC-G9EB-K BodyPattern Name: Single We bought this from Amazon Warehouse for about 60% of the current full price, and the quality is fantastic. Coming from Olympus OM-D EM5 (Mark 1), the image and video quality of the G9 is a step up. It's quite a large body, but the grip makes it easier to handle. Autofocus is much faster, and improved a lot more when we updated the firmware. It's interesting to compare this to my phone camera. It still doesn't do as well in low light as my Pixel, due to the processing that phones use. But if you're shooting with good lighting, the results are much better. Alexander D'Aulerio 5.0 out of 5 stars Great intuitive camera Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 24 January 2021 Style Name: DC-G9LEB-K + 12-60mm LensPattern Name: SingleVerified Purchase Although this camera is quite large for M43, in fact larger than some FF camera bodies, it never feels cumbersome, and it's ergonomics are second to none! It's a real shame that other camera manufacturers don't put the same effort into ergonomics that Panasonic do. The tactile controls and the simple UI make driving this camera an absolute pleasure. The bundled Leica 12-60 is also a great optic and has pretty much replaced my Lumix 14-140 as my all rounder lens, working great for landscape, street, and portrait photography. I regularly use the camera body with larger tele lenses of the M43 catalogue and the balance that it offers with them is fantastic. I would say if you err on the side of smaller lenses there are probably better options, but for my wildlife and travel photography, this really is a Goldilocks camera/system, a powerhouse of a body, combined with a great catalogue of comparatively small, light and affordable lenses. In summary this is a great camera, sure it won't be the answer for everyone, but I think every system is about compromise. For me this ticks the boxes for usability, affordability and image quality. 2 people found this helpful Helpful Report abuse Showing 0 comments There was a problem loading the comments at the moment. Best camera I have used Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 15 September 2021 Style Name: DC-G9EB-K BodyPattern Name: SingleVerified Purchase Forget its ability to let you set several instant personal program modes. Forget the easily to use lumix lenses of high quality. Just look at the images and for the PRICE find better. Face and eye recognition are almost perfect. Nikon, Canon and Sony are good certainly but at what price. One person found this helpful Helpful Report abuse Showing 0 comments There was a problem loading the comments at the moment. Please try again later. Lynn 5.0 out of 5 stars Great camera for the price Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 21 June 2021 Style Name: DC-G9EB-K BodyPattern Name: SingleVerified Purchase The G9 is a big improvement over its predecessor the G8. I use it for wildlife photography to a large extent and the lack of delay, great focusing and excellent stabilisation features provide some good shots when coupled with the Lumix 100 - 400mm lens. I highly recommend. Helpful Report abuse Showing 0 comments There was a problem loading the comments at the moment. Please try again later. Alex 5.0 out of 5 stars Great camera, especially with a Warehouse deal Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 20 May 2021 Style Name: DC-G9EB-K BodyPattern Name: Single We bought this from Amazon Warehouse for about 60% of the current full price, and the quality is fantastic. Coming from Olympus OM-D EM5 (Mark 1), the image and video quality of the G9 is a step up. It's quite a large body, but the grip makes it easier to handle. Autofocus is much faster, and improved a lot more when we updated the firmware. It's interesting to compare this to my phone camera. It still doesn't do as well in low light as my Pixel, due to the processing that phones use. But if you're shooting with good lighting, the results are much better. One person found this helpful Helpful Report abuse Showing 0 comments There was a problem loading the comments at the moment. Please try again later. Steve S 5.0 out of 5 stars Fantastic camera. Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 12 March 2021 Style Name: DC-G9LEB-K + 12-60mm LensPattern Name: SingleVerified Purchase A really great camera, I'm new to photography and able to use its function's well, great pictures, and a lot of lens available. Helpful Report abuse Showing 0 comments There was a problem loading the comments at the moment. Please try again later. Kindle Customer 5.0 out of 5 stars I'm not an expert but I appreciate class Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 13 February 2021 Style Name: DC-G9LEB-K + 12-60mm LensPattern Name: SingleVerified Purchase Great camera. I have used Sony and fujifilms before but this tops them all in both picture quality and build. I think Panasonic Lumix is very understated and surprised they are not used by more professional photographers. I have even used some Leicas in the past but this was better. 2 people found this helpful Helpful Report abuse Showing 0 comments There was a problem loading the comments at the moment. Please try again later. Alexander D'Aulerio 5.0 out of 5 stars Great intuitive camera Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 24 January 2021 Style Name: DC-G9LEB-K + 12-60mm LensPattern Name: SingleVerified Purchase Although this camera is quite large for M43, in fact larger than some FF camera bodies, it never feels cumbersome, and it's ergonomics are second to none! It's a real shame that other camera manufacturers don't put the same effort into ergonomics that Panasonic do. The tactile controls and the simple UI make driving this camera an absolute pleasure. The bundled Leica 12-60 is also a great optic and has pretty much replaced my Lumix 14-140 as my all rounder lens, working great for landscape, street, and portrait photography. I regularly use the camera body with larger tele lenses of the M43 catalogue and the balance that it offers with them is fantastic. I would say if you err on the side of smaller lenses there are probably better options, but for my wildlife and travel photography, this really is a Goldilocks camera/system, a powerhouse of a body, combined with a great catalogue of comparatively small, light and affordable lenses. In summary this is a great camera, sure it won't be the answer for everyone, but I think every system is about compromise. For me this ticks the boxes for usability, affordability and image quality. 2 people found this helpful Helpful Report abuse Showing 0 comments There was a problem loading the comments at the moment. Please try again later. G. B. P. Madden 5.0 out of 5 stars Worth the money Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 9 January 2021 Style Name: DC-G9EB-K BodyPattern Name: SingleVerified Purchase Not sure why I have to rate it by warmth and thickness, but this is a very fast, highly adaptable camera. Loads of functions, superb image quality. Good autofocus. I bought this after years of having a G3 which was very slow with an erratic autofocus, but I had lots of M4/3 lenses I didn't want to get rid of. This has given me hopefully years more M4/3 use 2 people found this helpful Helpful Report abuse Showing 0 comments There was a problem loading the comments at the moment. 5.0 out of 5 stars Best camera I have used Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 15 September 2021 Style Name: DC-G9EB-K BodyPattern Name: SingleVerified Purchase Forget its ability to let you set several instant personal program modes. Forget the easily to use lumix lenses of high quality. Just look at the images and for the PRICE find better. Face and eye recognition are almost perfect. Nikon, Canon and Sony are good certainly but at what price. One person found this helpful Helpful Report abuse Showing 0 comments There was a problem loading the comments at the moment. Please try again later. paul richards 5.0 out of 5 stars Would buy again Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 11 July 2021 Style Name: DC-G9MEB-K + 12-60mm LensPattern Name: SingleVerified Purchase Excellent camera would highly recommend Helpful Report abuse Showing 0 comments There was a problem loading the comments at the moment. Please try again later. Lynn 5.0 out of 5 stars Great camera for the price Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 21 June 2021 Style Name: DC-G9EB-K BodyPattern Name: SingleVerified Purchase The G9 is a big improvement over its predecessor the G8. I use it for wildlife photography to a large extent and the lack of delay, great focusing and excellent stabilisation features provide some good shots when coupled with the Lumix 100 - 400mm lens. I highly recommend. Helpful Report abuse Showing 0 comments There was a problem loading the comments at the moment. Please try again later. Alex 5.0 out of 5 stars Great camera, especially with a Warehouse deal Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 20 May 2021 Style Name: DC-G9EB-K BodyPattern Name: Single We bought this from Amazon Warehouse for about 60% of the current full price, and the quality is fantastic. Coming from Olympus OM-D EM5 (Mark 1), the image and video quality of the G9 is a step up. It's quite a large body, but the grip makes it easier to handle. Autofocus is much faster, and improved a lot more when we updated the firmware. It's interesting to compare this to my phone camera. It still doesn't do as well in low light as my Pixel, due to the processing that phones use. But if you're shooting with good lighting, the results are much better. Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 12 March 2021 Style Name: DC-G9LEB-K + 12-60mm LensPattern Name: SingleVerified Purchase A really great camera, I'm new to photography and able to use its function's well, great pictures, and a lot of lens available. Helpful Report abuse Showing 0 comments There was a problem loading the comments at the moment. Please try again later. Kindle Customer 5.0 out of 5 stars I'm not an expert but I appreciate class Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 13 February 2021 Style Name: DC-G9LEB-K + 12-60mm LensPattern Name: SingleVerified Purchase Great camera. I have used Sony and fujifilms before but this tops them all in both picture quality and build. I think Panasonic Lumix is very understated and surprised they are not used by more professional photographers. I have even used some Leicas in the past but this was better. 2 people found this helpful Helpful Report abuse Showing 0 comments There was a problem loading the comments at the moment. Please try again later. Alexander D'Aulerio 5.0 out of 5 stars Great intuitive camera Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 24 January 2021 Style Name: DC-G9LEB-K + 12-60mm LensPattern Name: SingleVerified Purchase Although this camera is quite large for M43, in fact larger than some FF camera bodies, it never feels cumbersome, and it's ergonomics are second to none! It's a real shame that other camera manufacturers don't put the same effort into ergonomics that Panasonic do. The tactile controls and the simple UI make driving this camera an absolute pleasure. The bundled Leica 12-60 is also a great optic and has pretty much replaced my Lumix 14-140 as my all rounder lens, working great for landscape, street, and portrait photography. I regularly use the camera body with larger tele lenses of the M43 catalogue and the balance that it offers with them is fantastic. I would say if you err on the side of smaller lenses there are probably better options, but for my wildlife and travel photography, this really is a Goldilocks camera/system, a powerhouse of a body, combined with a great catalogue of comparatively small, light and affordable lenses. In summary this is a great camera, sure it won't be the answer for everyone, but I think every system is about compromise. Would buy again Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 11 July 2021 Style Name: DC-G9MEB-K + 12-60mm LensPattern Name: SingleVerified Purchase Excellent camera would highly recommend Helpful Report abuse Showing 0 comments There was a problem loading the comments at the moment. Please try again later. Lynn 5.0 out of 5 stars Great camera for the price Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 21 June 2021 Style Name: DC-G9EB-K BodyPattern Name: SingleVerified Purchase The G9 is a big improvement over its predecessor the G8. I use it for wildlife photography to a large extent and the lack of delay, great focusing and excellent stabilisation features provide some good shots when coupled with the Lumix 100 - 400mm lens. I highly recommend. Helpful Report abuse Showing 0 comments There was a problem loading the comments at the moment. Please try again later. Alex 5.0 out of 5 stars Great camera, especially with a Warehouse deal Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 20 May 2021 Style Name: DC-G9EB-K BodyPattern Name: Single We bought this from Amazon Warehouse for about 60% of the current full price, and the quality is fantastic. Coming from Olympus OM-D EM5 (Mark 1), the image and video quality of the G9 is a step up. It's quite a large body, but the grip makes it easier to handle. Autofocus is much faster, and improved a lot more when we updated the firmware. It's interesting to compare this to my phone camera. It still doesn't do as well in low light as my Pixel, due to the processing that phones use. But if you're shooting with good lighting, the results are much better. One person found this helpful Helpful Report abuse Showing 0 comments There was a problem loading the comments at the moment. Please try again later. Steve S 5.0 out of 5 stars Fantastic camera. Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 12 March 2021 Style Name: DC-G9LEB-K + 12-60mm LensPattern Name: SingleVerified Purchase A really great camera, I'm new to photography and able to use its function's well, great pictures, and a lot of lens available. Helpful Report abuse Showing 0 comments There was a problem loading the comments at the moment. Please try again later. Kindle Customer 5.0 out of 5 stars I'm not an expert but I appreciate class Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 13 February 2021 Style Name: DC-G9LEB-K + 12-60mm LensPattern Name: SingleVerified Purchase Great camera. I have used Sony and fujifilms before but this tops them all in both picture quality and build. I think Panasonic Lumix is very understated and surprised they are not used by more professional photographers. I have even used some Leicas in the past but this was better. 2 people found this helpful Helpful Report abuse Showing 0 comments There was a problem loading the comments at the moment. Please try again later. Alexander D'Aulerio 5.0 out of 5 stars Great intuitive camera Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 24 January 2021 Style Name: DC-G9LEB-K + 12-60mm LensPattern Name: SingleVerified Purchase Although this camera is quite large for M43, in fact larger than some FF camera bodies, it never feels cumbersome, and it's ergonomics are second to none! It's a real shame that other camera manufacturers don't put the same effort into ergonomics that Panasonic do. The tactile controls and the simple UI make driving this camera an absolute pleasure. The bundled Leica 12-60 is also a great optic and has pretty much replaced my Lumix 14-140 as my all rounder lens, working great for landscape, street, and portrait photography. I regularly use the camera body with larger tele lenses of the M43 catalogue and the balance that it offers with them is fantastic. I would say if you err on the side of smaller lenses there are probably better options, but for my wildlife and travel photography, this really is a Goldilocks camera/system, a powerhouse of a body, combined with a great catalogue of comparatively small, light and affordable lenses. In summary this is a great camera, sure it won't be the answer for everyone, but I think every system is about compromise. For me this ticks the boxes for usability, affordability and image quality. 2 people found this helpful Helpful Report abuse Showing 0 comments There was a problem loading the comments at the moment. Please try again later. G. B. P. Madden 5.0 out of 5 stars Worth the money Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 9 January 2021 Style Name: DC-G9EB-K BodyPattern Name: SingleVerified Purchase Not sure why I have to rate it by warmth and thickness, but this is a very fast, highly adaptable camera. Loads of functions, superb image quality. Good autofocus. I bought this after years of having a G3 which was very slow with an erratic autofocus, but I had lots of M4/3 lenses I didn't want to get rid of. This has given me hopefully years more M4/3 use 2 people found this helpful Helpful Report abuse Showing 0 comments There was a problem loading the comments at the moment. Lynn 5.0 out of 5 stars Great camera for the price Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 21 June 2021 Style Name: DC-G9EB-K BodyPattern Name: SingleVerified Purchase The G9 is a big improvement over its predecessor the G8. I use it for wildlife photography to a large extent and the lack of delay, great focusing and excellent stabilisation features provide some good shots when coupled with the Lumix 100 - 400mm lens. I highly recommend. Helpful Report abuse Showing 0 comments There was a problem loading the comments at the moment. Please try again later. Alex 5.0 out of 5 stars Great camera, especially with a Warehouse deal Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 20 May 2021 Style Name: DC-G9EB-K BodyPattern Name: Single We bought this from Amazon Warehouse for about 60% of the current full price, and the quality is fantastic. Coming from Olympus OM-D EM5 (Mark 1), the image and video quality of the G9 is a step up. It's quite a large body, but the grip makes it easier to handle. Autofocus is much faster, and improved a lot more when we updated the firmware. It's interesting to compare this to my phone camera. It still doesn't do as well in low light as my Pixel, due to the processing that phones use. But if you're shooting with good lighting, the results are much better. Kindle Customer 5.0 out of 5 stars I'm not an expert but I appreciate class Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 13 February 2021 Style Name: DC-G9LEB-K + 12-60mm LensPattern Name: SingleVerified Purchase Great camera. I have used Sony and fujifilms before but this tops them all in both picture quality and build. I think Panasonic Lumix is very understated and surprised they are not used by more professional photographers. I have even used some Leicas in the past but this was better. 2 people found this helpful Helpful Report abuse Showing 0 comments There was a problem loading the comments at the moment. Please try again later. Alexander D'Aulerio 5.0 out of 5 stars Great intuitive camera Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 24 January 2021 Style Name: DC-G9LEB-K + 12-60mm LensPattern Name: SingleVerified Purchase Although this camera is quite large for M43, in fact larger than some FF camera bodies, it never feels cumbersome, and it's ergonomics are second to none! It's a real shame that other camera manufacturers don't put the same effort into ergonomics that Panasonic do. The tactile controls and the simple UI make driving this camera an absolute pleasure. The bundled Leica 12-60 is also a great optic and has pretty much replaced my Lumix 14-140 as my all rounder lens, working great for landscape, street, and portrait photography. I regularly use the camera body with larger tele lenses of the M43 catalogue and the balance that it offers with them is fantastic. I would say if you err on the side of smaller lenses there are probably better options, but for my wildlife and travel photography, this really is a Goldilocks camera/system, a powerhouse of a body, combined with a great catalogue of comparatively small, light and affordable lenses. In summary this is a great camera, sure it won't be the answer for everyone, but I think every system is about compromise. For me this ticks the boxes for usability, affordability and image quality. 2 people found this helpful Helpful Report abuse Showing 0 comments There was a problem loading the comments at the moment. Please try again later. G. B. P. Madden 5.0 out of 5 stars Worth the money Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 9 January 2021 Style Name: DC-G9EB-K BodyPattern Name: SingleVerified Purchase Not sure why I have to rate it by warmth and thickness, but this is a very fast, highly adaptable camera. Loads of functions, superb image quality. Good autofocus. I bought this after years of having a G3 which was very slow with an erratic autofocus, but I had lots of M4/3 lenses I didn't want to get rid of. body: Excellent camera would highly recommendHelpfulReport abuseShowing 0 commentsThere was a problem load

title:
Great camera for the price Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 21 June 2021 Style Name: DC-G9EB-K BodyPattern Name: SingleVerified Purchase The G9 is a big improvement over its predecessor the G8. I use it for wildlife photography to a large extent and the lack of delay, great focusing and excellent stabilisation features provide some good shots when coupled with the Lumix 100 - 400mm lens. I highly recommend. Helpful Report abuse Showing 0 comments There was a problem loading the comments at the moment. Please try again later. Alex 5.0 out of 5 stars Great camera, especially with a Warehouse deal Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 20 May 2021 Style Name: DC-G9EB-K BodyPattern Name: Single We bought this from Amazon Warehouse for about 60% of the current full price, and the quality is fantastic. Coming from Olympus OM-D EM5 (Mark 1), the image and video quality of the G9 is a step up. It's quite a large body, but the grip makes it easier to handle. Autofocus is much faster, and improved a lot more when we updated the firmware. It's interesting to compare this to my phone camera. It still doesn't do as well in low light as my Pixel, due to the processing that phones use. But if you're shooting with good lighting, the results are much better. One person found this helpful Helpful Report abuse Showing 0 comments There was a problem loading the comments at the moment. Please try again later. Steve S 5.0 out of 5 stars Fantastic camera. Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 12 March 2021 Style Name: DC-G9LEB-K + 12-60mm LensPattern Name: SingleVerified Purchase A really great camera, I'm new to photography and able to use its function's well, great pictures, and a lot of lens available. Helpful Report abuse Showing 0 comments There was a problem loading the comments at the moment. Please try again later. Kindle Customer 5.0 out of 5 stars I'm not an expert but I appreciate class Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 13 February 2021 Style Name: DC-G9LEB-K + 12-60mm LensPattern Name: SingleVerified Purchase Great camera. I have used Sony and fujifilms before but this tops them all in both picture quality and build. I think Panasonic Lumix is very understated and surprised they are not used by more professional photographers. I have even used some Leicas in the past but this was better. 2 people found this helpful Helpful Report abuse Showing 0 comments There was a problem loading the comments at the moment. Please try again later. Alexander D'Aulerio 5.0 out of 5 stars Great intuitive camera Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 24 January 2021 Style Name: DC-G9LEB-K + 12-60mm LensPattern Name: SingleVerified Purchase Although this camera is quite large for M43, in fact larger than some FF camera bodies, it never feels cumbersome, and it's ergonomics are second to none! It's a real shame that other camera manufacturers don't put the same effort into ergonomics that Panasonic do. The tactile controls and the simple UI make driving this camera an absolute pleasure. The bundled Leica 12-60 is also a great optic and has pretty much replaced my Lumix 14-140 as my all rounder lens, working great for landscape, street, and portrait photography. I regularly use the camera body with larger tele lenses of the M43 catalogue and the balance that it offers with them is fantastic. I would say if you err on the side of smaller lenses there are probably better options, but for my wildlife and travel photography, this really is a Goldilocks camera/system, a powerhouse of a body, combined with a great catalogue of comparatively small, light and affordable lenses. In summary this is a great camera, sure it won't be the answer for everyone, but I think every system is about compromise. For me this ticks the boxes for usability, affordability and image quality. 2 people found this helpful Helpful Report abuse Showing 0 comments There was a problem loading the comments at the moment. Please try again later. G. B. P. Madden 5.0 out of 5 stars Worth the money Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 9 January 2021 Style Name: DC-G9EB-K BodyPattern Name: SingleVerified Purchase Not sure why I have to rate it by warmth and thickness, but this is a very fast, highly adaptable camera. Loads of functions, superb image quality. Good autofocus. I bought this after years of having a G3 which was very slow with an erratic autofocus, but I had lots of M4/3 lenses I didn't want to get rid of. This has given me hopefully years more M4/3 use 2 people found this helpful Helpful Report abuse Showing 0 comments There was a problem loading the comments at the moment. 5.0 out of 5 stars Great camera for the price Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 21 June 2021 Style Name: DC-G9EB-K BodyPattern Name: SingleVerified Purchase The G9 is a big improvement over its predecessor the G8. I use it for wildlife photography to a large extent and the lack of delay, great focusing and excellent stabilisation features provide some good shots when coupled with the Lumix 100 - 400mm lens. I highly recommend. Helpful Report abuse Showing 0 comments There was a problem loading the comments at the moment. Please try again later. Alex 5.0 out of 5 stars Great camera, especially with a Warehouse deal Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 20 May 2021 Style Name: DC-G9EB-K BodyPattern Name: Single We bought this from Amazon Warehouse for about 60% of the current full price, and the quality is fantastic. Coming from Olympus OM-D EM5 (Mark 1), the image and video quality of the G9 is a step up. It's quite a large body, but the grip makes it easier to handle. Autofocus is much faster, and improved a lot more when we updated the firmware. It's interesting to compare this to my phone camera. It still doesn't do as well in low light as my Pixel, due to the processing that phones use. But if you're shooting with good lighting, the results are much better. One person found this helpful Helpful Report abuse Showing 0 comments There was a problem loading the comments at the moment. Please try again later. Steve S 5.0 out of 5 stars Fantastic camera. Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 12 March 2021 Style Name: DC-G9LEB-K + 12-60mm LensPattern Name: SingleVerified Purchase A really great camera, I'm new to photography and able to use its function's well, great pictures, and a lot of lens available. Helpful Report abuse Showing 0 comments There was a problem loading the comments at the moment. Please try again later. Kindle Customer 5.0 out of 5 stars I'm not an expert but I appreciate class Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 13 February 2021 Style Name: DC-G9LEB-K + 12-60mm LensPattern Name: SingleVerified Purchase Great camera. I have used Sony and fujifilms before but this tops them all in both picture quality and build. I think Panasonic Lumix is very understated and surprised they are not used by more professional photographers. I have even used some Leicas in the past but this was better. 2 people found this helpful Helpful Report abuse Showing 0 comments There was a problem loading the comments at the moment. Please try again later. Alexander D'Aulerio 5.0 out of 5 stars Great intuitive camera Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 24 January 2021 Style Name: DC-G9LEB-K + 12-60mm LensPattern Name: SingleVerified Purchase Although this camera is quite large for M43, in fact larger than some FF camera bodies, it never feels cumbersome, and it's ergonomics are second to none! It's a real shame that other camera manufacturers don't put the same effort into ergonomics that Panasonic do. The tactile controls and the simple UI make driving this camera an absolute pleasure. The bundled Leica 12-60 is also a great optic and has pretty much replaced my Lumix 14-140 as my all rounder lens, working great for landscape, street, and portrait photography. I regularly use the camera body with larger tele lenses of the M43 catalogue and the balance that it offers with them is fantastic. I would say if you err on the side of smaller lenses there are probably better options, but for my wildlife and travel photography, this really is a Goldilocks camera/system, a powerhouse of a body, combined with a great catalogue of comparatively small, light and affordable lenses. In summary this is a great camera, sure it won't be the answer for everyone, but I think every system is about compromise. For me this ticks the boxes for usability, affordability and image quality. 2 people found this helpful Helpful Report abuse Showing 0 comments There was a problem loading the comments at the moment. Please try again later. G. B. P. Madden 5.0 out of 5 stars Worth the money Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 9 January 2021 Style Name: DC-G9EB-K BodyPattern Name: SingleVerified Purchase Not sure why I have to rate it by warmth and thickness, but this is a very fast, highly adaptable camera. Loads of functions, superb image quality. Good autofocus. I bought this after years of having a G3 which was very slow with an erratic autofocus, but I had lots of M4/3 lenses I didn't want to get rid of. This has given me hopefully years more M4/3 use 2 people found this helpful Helpful Report abuse Showing 0 comments There was a problem loading the comments at the moment. body: The G9 is a big improvement over its predecessor the G8. I use it for wildlife photography to a larg

title:
Great camera, especially with a Warehouse deal Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 20 May 2021 Style Name: DC-G9EB-K BodyPattern Name: Single We bought this from Amazon Warehouse for about 60% of the current full price, and the quality is fantastic. Coming from Olympus OM-D EM5 (Mark 1), the image and video quality of the G9 is a step up. It's quite a large body, but the grip makes it easier to handle. Autofocus is much faster, and improved a lot more when we updated the firmware. It's interesting to compare this to my phone camera. It still doesn't do as well in low light as my Pixel, due to the processing that phones use. But if you're shooting with good lighting, the results are much better. One person found this helpful Helpful Report abuse Showing 0 comments There was a problem loading the comments at the moment. Please try again later. Steve S 5.0 out of 5 stars Fantastic camera. Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 12 March 2021 Style Name: DC-G9LEB-K + 12-60mm LensPattern Name: SingleVerified Purchase A really great camera, I'm new to photography and able to use its function's well, great pictures, and a lot of lens available. Helpful Report abuse Showing 0 comments There was a problem loading the comments at the moment. Please try again later. Kindle Customer 5.0 out of 5 stars I'm not an expert but I appreciate class Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 13 February 2021 Style Name: DC-G9LEB-K + 12-60mm LensPattern Name: SingleVerified Purchase Great camera. I have used Sony and fujifilms before but this tops them all in both picture quality and build. I think Panasonic Lumix is very understated and surprised they are not used by more professional photographers. I have even used some Leicas in the past but this was better. 2 people found this helpful Helpful Report abuse Showing 0 comments There was a problem loading the comments at the moment. Please try again later. Alexander D'Aulerio 5.0 out of 5 stars Great intuitive camera Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 24 January 2021 Style Name: DC-G9LEB-K + 12-60mm LensPattern Name: SingleVerified Purchase Although this camera is quite large for M43, in fact larger than some FF camera bodies, it never feels cumbersome, and it's ergonomics are second to none! It's a real shame that other camera manufacturers don't put the same effort into ergonomics that Panasonic do. The tactile controls and the simple UI make driving this camera an absolute pleasure. The bundled Leica 12-60 is also a great optic and has pretty much replaced my Lumix 14-140 as my all rounder lens, working great for landscape, street, and portrait photography. I regularly use the camera body with larger tele lenses of the M43 catalogue and the balance that it offers with them is fantastic. I would say if you err on the side of smaller lenses there are probably better options, but for my wildlife and travel photography, this really is a Goldilocks camera/system, a powerhouse of a body, combined with a great catalogue of comparatively small, light and affordable lenses. In summary this is a great camera, sure it won't be the answer for everyone, but I think every system is about compromise. For me this ticks the boxes for usability, affordability and image quality. 2 people found this helpful Helpful Report abuse Showing 0 comments There was a problem loading the comments at the moment. Please try again later. G. B. P. Madden 5.0 out of 5 stars Worth the money Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 9 January 2021 Style Name: DC-G9EB-K BodyPattern Name: SingleVerified Purchase Not sure why I have to rate it by warmth and thickness, but this is a very fast, highly adaptable camera. Loads of functions, superb image quality. Good autofocus. I bought this after years of having a G3 which was very slow with an erratic autofocus, but I had lots of M4/3 lenses I didn't want to get rid of. This has given me hopefully years more M4/3 use 2 people found this helpful Helpful Report abuse Showing 0 comments There was a problem loading the comments at the moment. 5.0 out of 5 stars Great camera, especially with a Warehouse deal Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 20 May 2021 Style Name: DC-G9EB-K BodyPattern Name: Single We bought this from Amazon Warehouse for about 60% of the current full price, and the quality is fantastic. Coming from Olympus OM-D EM5 (Mark 1), the image and video quality of the G9 is a step up. It's quite a large body, but the grip makes it easier to handle. Autofocus is much faster, and improved a lot more when we updated the firmware. It's interesting to compare this to my phone camera. It still doesn't do as well in low light as my Pixel, due to the processing that phones use. But if you're shooting with good lighting, the results are much better. One person found this helpful Helpful Report abuse Showing 0 comments There was a problem loading the comments at the moment. Please try again later. Steve S 5.0 out of 5 stars Fantastic camera. Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 12 March 2021 Style Name: DC-G9LEB-K + 12-60mm LensPattern Name: SingleVerified Purchase A really great camera, I'm new to photography and able to use its function's well, great pictures, and a lot of lens available. Helpful Report abuse Showing 0 comments There was a problem loading the comments at the moment. Please try again later. Kindle Customer 5.0 out of 5 stars I'm not an expert but I appreciate class Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 13 February 2021 Style Name: DC-G9LEB-K + 12-60mm LensPattern Name: SingleVerified Purchase Great camera. I have used Sony and fujifilms before but this tops them all in both picture quality and build. I think Panasonic Lumix is very understated and surprised they are not used by more professional photographers. I have even used some Leicas in the past but this was better. 2 people found this helpful Helpful Report abuse Showing 0 comments There was a problem loading the comments at the moment. Please try again later. Alexander D'Aulerio 5.0 out of 5 stars Great intuitive camera Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 24 January 2021 Style Name: DC-G9LEB-K + 12-60mm LensPattern Name: SingleVerified Purchase Although this camera is quite large for M43, in fact larger than some FF camera bodies, it never feels cumbersome, and it's ergonomics are second to none! It's a real shame that other camera manufacturers don't put the same effort into ergonomics that Panasonic do. The tactile controls and the simple UI make driving this camera an absolute pleasure. The bundled Leica 12-60 is also a great optic and has pretty much replaced my Lumix 14-140 as my all rounder lens, working great for landscape, street, and portrait photography. I regularly use the camera body with larger tele lenses of the M43 catalogue and the balance that it offers with them is fantastic. I would say if you err on the side of smaller lenses there are probably better options, but for my wildlife and travel photography, this really is a Goldilocks camera/system, a powerhouse of a body, combined with a great catalogue of comparatively small, light and affordable lenses. In summary this is a great camera, sure it won't be the answer for everyone, but I think every system is about compromise. For me this ticks the boxes for usability, affordability and image quality. 2 people found this helpful Helpful Report abuse Showing 0 comments There was a problem loading the comments at the moment. Please try again later. G. B. P. Madden 5.0 out of 5 stars Worth the money Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 9 January 2021 Style Name: DC-G9EB-K BodyPattern Name: SingleVerified Purchase Not sure why I have to rate it by warmth and thickness, but this is a very fast, highly adaptable camera. Loads of functions, superb image quality. Good autofocus. I bought this after years of having a G3 which was very slow with an erratic autofocus, but I had lots of M4/3 lenses I didn't want to get rid of. This has given me hopefully years more M4/3 use 2 people found this helpful Helpful Report abuse Showing 0 comments There was a problem loading the comments at the moment. title:
Fantastic camera. Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 12 March 2021 Style Name: DC-G9LEB-K + 12-60mm LensPattern Name: SingleVerified Purchase A really great camera, I'm new to photography and able to use its function's well, great pictures, and a lot of lens available. Helpful Report abuse Showing 0 comments There was a problem loading the comments at the moment. Please try again later. Kindle Customer 5.0 out of 5 stars I'm not an expert but I appreciate class Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 13 February 2021 Style Name: DC-G9LEB-K + 12-60mm LensPattern Name: SingleVerified Purchase Great camera. I have used Sony and fujifilms before but this tops them all in both picture quality and build. I think Panasonic Lumix is very understated and surprised they are not used by more professional photographers. I have even used some Leicas in the past but this was better. 2 people found this helpful Helpful Report abuse Showing 0 comments There was a problem loading the comments at the moment. Please try again later. Alexander D'Aulerio 5.0 out of 5 stars Great intuitive camera Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 24 January 2021 Style Name: DC-G9LEB-K + 12-60mm LensPattern Name: SingleVerified Purchase Although this camera is quite large for M43, in fact larger than some FF camera bodies, it never feels cumbersome, and it's ergonomics are second to none! It's a real shame that other camera manufacturers don't put the same effort into ergonomics that Panasonic do. The tactile controls and the simple UI make driving this camera an absolute pleasure. The bundled Leica 12-60 is also a great optic and has pretty much replaced my Lumix 14-140 as my all rounder lens, working great for landscape, street, and portrait photography. I regularly use the camera body with larger tele lenses of the M43 catalogue and the balance that it offers with them is fantastic. I would say if you err on the side of smaller lenses there are probably better options, but for my wildlife and travel photography, this really is a Goldilocks camera/system, a powerhouse of a body, combined with a great catalogue of comparatively small, light and affordable lenses. In summary this is a great camera, sure it won't be the answer for everyone, but I think every system is about compromise. For me this ticks the boxes for usability, affordability and image quality. 2 people found this helpful Helpful Report abuse Showing 0 comments There was a problem loading the comments at the moment. Please try again later. G. B. P. Madden 5.0 out of 5 stars Worth the money Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 9 January 2021 Style Name: DC-G9EB-K BodyPattern Name: SingleVerified Purchase Not sure why I have to rate it by warmth and thickness, but this is a very fast, highly adaptable camera. Loads of functions, superb image quality. Good autofocus. I bought this after years of having a G3 which was very slow with an erratic autofocus, but I had lots of M4/3 lenses I didn't want to get rid of. This has given me hopefully years more M4/3 use 2 people found this helpful Helpful Report abuse Showing 0 comments There was a problem loading the comments at the moment. Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 12 March 2021 Style Name: DC-G9LEB-K + 12-60mm LensPattern Name: SingleVerified Purchase A really great camera, I'm new to photography and able to use its function's well, great pictures, and a lot of lens available. Helpful Report abuse Showing 0 comments There was a problem loading the comments at the moment. Please try again later. Kindle Customer 5.0 out of 5 stars I'm not an expert but I appreciate class Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 13 February 2021 Style Name: DC-G9LEB-K + 12-60mm LensPattern Name: SingleVerified Purchase Great camera. I have used Sony and fujifilms before but this tops them all in both picture quality and build. I think Panasonic Lumix is very understated and surprised they are not used by more professional photographers. I have even used some Leicas in the past but this was better. 2 people found this helpful Helpful Report abuse Showing 0 comments There was a problem loading the comments at the moment. Alexander D'Aulerio 5.0 out of 5 stars Great intuitive camera Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 24 January 2021 Style Name: DC-G9LEB-K + 12-60mm LensPattern Name: SingleVerified Purchase Although this camera is quite large for M43, in fact larger than some FF camera bodies, it never feels cumbersome, and it's ergonomics are second to none! It's a real shame that other camera manufacturers don't put the same effort into ergonomics that Panasonic do. The tactile controls and the simple UI make driving this camera an absolute pleasure. The bundled Leica 12-60 is also a great optic and has pretty much replaced my Lumix 14-140 as my all rounder lens, working great for landscape, street, and portrait photography. I regularly use the camera body with larger tele lenses of the M43 catalogue and the balance that it offers with them is fantastic. I would say if you err on the side of smaller lenses there are probably better options, but for my wildlife and travel photography, this really is a Goldilocks camera/system, a powerhouse of a body, combined with a great catalogue of comparatively small, light and affordable lenses. In summary this is a great camera, sure it won't be the answer for everyone, but I think every system is about compromise. For me this ticks the boxes for usability, affordability and image quality. 2 people found this helpful Helpful Report abuse Showing 0 comments There was a problem loading the comments at the moment. Please try again later. G. B. P. Madden 5.0 out of 5 stars Worth the money Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 9 January 2021 Style Name: DC-G9EB-K BodyPattern Name: SingleVerified Purchase Not sure why I have to rate it by warmth and thickness, but this is a very fast, highly adaptable camera. Loads of functions, superb image quality. Good autofocus. I bought this after years of having a G3 which was very slow with an erratic autofocus, but I had lots of M4/3 lenses I didn't want to get rid of. title:
I'm not an expert but I appreciate class Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 13 February 2021 Style Name: DC-G9LEB-K + 12-60mm LensPattern Name: SingleVerified Purchase Great camera. I have used Sony and fujifilms before but this tops them all in both picture quality and build. I think Panasonic Lumix is very understated and surprised they are not used by more professional photographers. I have even used some Leicas in the past but this was better. 2 people found this helpful Helpful Report abuse Showing 0 comments There was a problem loading the comments at the moment. Please try again later. Alexander D'Aulerio 5.0 out of 5 stars Great intuitive camera Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 24 January 2021 Style Name: DC-G9LEB-K + 12-60mm LensPattern Name: SingleVerified Purchase Although this camera is quite large for M43, in fact larger than some FF camera bodies, it never feels cumbersome, and it's ergonomics are second to none! It's a real shame that other camera manufacturers don't put the same effort into ergonomics that Panasonic do. The tactile controls and the simple UI make driving this camera an absolute pleasure. The bundled Leica 12-60 is also a great optic and has pretty much replaced my Lumix 14-140 as my all rounder lens, working great for landscape, street, and portrait photography. I regularly use the camera body with larger tele lenses of the M43 catalogue and the balance that it offers with them is fantastic. I would say if you err on the side of smaller lenses there are probably better options, but for my wildlife and travel photography, this really is a Goldilocks camera/system, a powerhouse of a body, combined with a great catalogue of comparatively small, light and affordable lenses. In summary this is a great camera, sure it won't be the answer for everyone, but I think every system is about compromise. For me this ticks the boxes for usability, affordability and image quality. 2 people found this helpful Helpful Report abuse Showing 0 comments There was a problem loading the comments at the moment. Please try again later. G. B. P. Madden 5.0 out of 5 stars Worth the money Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 9 January 2021 Style Name: DC-G9EB-K BodyPattern Name: SingleVerified Purchase Not sure why I have to rate it by warmth and thickness, but this is a very fast, highly adaptable camera. Loads of functions, superb image quality. Good autofocus. I bought this after years of having a G3 which was very slow with an erratic autofocus, but I had lots of M4/3 lenses I didn't want to get rid of. This has given me hopefully years more M4/3 use 2 people found this helpful Helpful Report abuse Showing 0 comments There was a problem loading the comments at the moment. 5.0 out of 5 stars I'm not an expert but I appreciate class Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 13 February 2021 Style Name: DC-G9LEB-K + 12-60mm LensPattern Name: SingleVerified Purchase Great camera. I have used Sony and fujifilms before but this tops them all in both picture quality and build. I think Panasonic Lumix is very understated and surprised they are not used by more professional photographers. I have even used some Leicas in the past but this was better. 2 people found this helpful Helpful Report abuse Showing 0 comments There was a problem loading the comments at the moment. Please try again later. Alexander D'Aulerio 5.0 out of 5 stars Great intuitive camera Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 24 January 2021 Style Name: DC-G9LEB-K + 12-60mm LensPattern Name: SingleVerified Purchase Although this camera is quite large for M43, in fact larger than some FF camera bodies, it never feels cumbersome, and it's ergonomics are second to none! It's a real shame that other camera manufacturers don't put the same effort into ergonomics that Panasonic do. The tactile controls and the simple UI make driving this camera an absolute pleasure. The bundled Leica 12-60 is also a great optic and has pretty much replaced my Lumix 14-140 as my all rounder lens, working great for landscape, street, and portrait photography. I regularly use the camera body with larger tele lenses of the M43 catalogue and the balance that it offers with them is fantastic. I would say if you err on the side of smaller lenses there are probably better options, but for my wildlife and travel photography, this really is a Goldilocks camera/system, a powerhouse of a body, combined with a great catalogue of comparatively small, light and affordable lenses. In summary this is a great camera, sure it won't be the answer for everyone, but I think every system is about compromise. For me this ticks the boxes for usability, affordability and image quality. 2 people found this helpful Helpful Report abuse Showing 0 comments There was a problem loading the comments at the moment. Please try again later. G. B. P. Madden 5.0 out of 5 stars Worth the money Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 9 January 2021 Style Name: DC-G9EB-K BodyPattern Name: SingleVerified Purchase Not sure why I have to rate it by warmth and thickness, but this is a very fast, highly adaptable camera. Loads of functions, superb image quality. Good autofocus. I bought this after years of having a G3 which was very slow with an erratic autofocus, but I had lots of M4/3 lenses I didn't want to get rid of. This has given me hopefully years more M4/3 use 2 people found this helpful Helpful Report abuse Showing 0 comments There was a problem loading the comments at the moment. body: Great camera. I have used Sony and fujifilms before but this tops them all in both picture quality a

title:
Great intuitive camera Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 24 January 2021 Style Name: DC-G9LEB-K + 12-60mm LensPattern Name: SingleVerified Purchase Although this camera is quite large for M43, in fact larger than some FF camera bodies, it never feels cumbersome, and it's ergonomics are second to none! It's a real shame that other camera manufacturers don't put the same effort into ergonomics that Panasonic do. The tactile controls and the simple UI make driving this camera an absolute pleasure. The bundled Leica 12-60 is also a great optic and has pretty much replaced my Lumix 14-140 as my all rounder lens, working great for landscape, street, and portrait photography. I regularly use the camera body with larger tele lenses of the M43 catalogue and the balance that it offers with them is fantastic. I would say if you err on the side of smaller lenses there are probably better options, but for my wildlife and travel photography, this really is a Goldilocks camera/system, a powerhouse of a body, combined with a great catalogue of comparatively small, light and affordable lenses. In summary this is a great camera, sure it won't be the answer for everyone, but I think every system is about compromise. For me this ticks the boxes for usability, affordability and image quality. 2 people found this helpful Helpful Report abuse Showing 0 comments There was a problem loading the comments at the moment. Please try again later. G. B. P. Madden 5.0 out of 5 stars Worth the money Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 9 January 2021 Style Name: DC-G9EB-K BodyPattern Name: SingleVerified Purchase Not sure why I have to rate it by warmth and thickness, but this is a very fast, highly adaptable camera. Loads of functions, superb image quality. Good autofocus. I bought this after years of having a G3 which was very slow with an erratic autofocus, but I had lots of M4/3 lenses I didn't want to get rid of. This has given me hopefully years more M4/3 use 2 people found this helpful Helpful Report abuse Showing 0 comments There was a problem loading the comments at the moment. 5.0 out of 5 stars Great intuitive camera Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 24 January 2021 Style Name: DC-G9LEB-K + 12-60mm LensPattern Name: SingleVerified Purchase Although this camera is quite large for M43, in fact larger than some FF camera bodies, it never feels cumbersome, and it's ergonomics are second to none! It's a real shame that other camera manufacturers don't put the same effort into ergonomics that Panasonic do. The tactile controls and the simple UI make driving this camera an absolute pleasure. The bundled Leica 12-60 is also a great optic and has pretty much replaced my Lumix 14-140 as my all rounder lens, working great for landscape, street, and portrait photography. I regularly use the camera body with larger tele lenses of the M43 catalogue and the balance that it offers with them is fantastic. I would say if you err on the side of smaller lenses there are probably better options, but for my wildlife and travel photography, this really is a Goldilocks camera/system, a powerhouse of a body, combined with a great catalogue of comparatively small, light and affordable lenses. In summary this is a great camera, sure it won't be the answer for everyone, but I think every system is about compromise. For me this ticks the boxes for usability, affordability and image quality. 2 people found this helpful Helpful Report abuse Showing 0 comments There was a problem loading the comments at the moment. Please try again later. G. B. P. Madden 5.0 out of 5 stars Worth the money Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 9 January 2021 Style Name: DC-G9EB-K BodyPattern Name: SingleVerified Purchase Not sure why I have to rate it by warmth and thickness, but this is a very fast, highly adaptable camera. Loads of functions, superb image quality. Good autofocus. I bought this after years of having a G3 which was very slow with an erratic autofocus, but I had lots of M4/3 lenses I didn't want to get rid of. This has given me hopefully years more M4/3 use 2 people found this helpful Helpful Report abuse Showing 0 comments There was a problem loading the comments at the moment. title:
Worth the money Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 9 January 2021 Style Name: DC-G9EB-K BodyPattern Name: SingleVerified Purchase Not sure why I have to rate it by warmth and thickness, but this is a very fast, highly adaptable camera. Loads of functions, superb image quality. Good autofocus. I bought this after years of having a G3 which was very slow with an erratic autofocus, but I had lots of M4/3 lenses I didn't want to get rid of. This has given me hopefully years more M4/3 use 2 people found this helpful Helpful Report abuse Showing 0 comments There was a problem loading the comments at the moment.
